scenario:
S&P Global Inc. SPGI shares are trading higher in the premarket session on Tuesday. The company reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings per share of $3.77, beating the street view of $3.48. Quarterly sales of $3.592 billion (+14%) outpaced the analyst consensus estimate of $3.503 billion, driven by growth in all divisions. Revenue from subscription products increased 6%.

Adjusted operating profit margin increased 260 basis points to 46.7%, primarily due to strength in the Ratings unit. The company exited the quarter with cash and equivalents worth $1.66 billion and long-term debt of $11.394 billion.

S&P Global recently authorized a quarterly cash dividend of $0.96, marking the company's 52nd consecutive year of dividend increases. The Board has also authorized the repurchase of shares totaling up to $4.3 billion, with an initial $650 million Accelerated Share Repurchase to be launched in the coming weeks.

For the full year 2025, S&P Global maintains its target of returning 85% or more of adjusted free cash flow to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases. The company projects FY25 revenue growth of 5% – 7%, along with adjusted EPS in the range of $17.00 to $17.25, above the $16.92 estimate.

S&P Global expects 2025 cash provided by operating activities, less capital expenditures and distributions to noncontrolling interest holders, of ~$5.9 billion. It expects adjusted free cash flow, excluding certain items, of $6 billion.
